frame.name: Architectural_part
frame.definition:
<def-root>An entity is integrated into a building as a <fen>Part</fen> of a (possibly unexpressed) <fen>Whole</fen> which may refer to the whole building or merely to a sub-part of the building.
<ex>We need <fex name="Dsc">new</fex> <fex name="Part"><t>counters</t></fex> for the kitchen</ex>
<ex>The storm ripped off the <fex name="Whole">bathroom's</fex> <fex name="Part"><t>roof</t></fex></ex>
</def-root>

FE.name: Part
FE.definition:
<def-root>A <fen>Part</fen> of a larger architectural unit, the <fen>Whole</fen>.
<ex>Marty leaned against the <fex name="Part"><t>fireplace</t></fex>.</ex></def-root>

FE.name: Whole
FE.definition:
<def-root>An architectural unit which includes the <fen>Part</fen>.
<ex>The <fex name="Whole">living-room</fex> <t>fireplace</t> is just for show.</ex></def-root>

FE.name: Descriptor
FE.definition:
<def-root>A property relating to the <fen>Part</fen>.
<ex>The building had a <fex name="Dsc">dilapidated</fex> <t>facade</t>. </ex></def-root>

FE.name: Orientation
FE.definition:
<def-root>This is a property of the <fen>Part</fen> that situates the <fen>Part</fen> within the <fen>Whole</fen>.
<ex>Looks like he fell through the <fex name="Orientation">side</fex> <t>wall</t>, innit?</ex> </def-root>

FE.name: Material
FE.definition:
<def-root>Any indication of what makes up the <fen>Part</fen>, including components, ingredients, etc.
<ex>The house has a <fex name="Material">marble</fex> <t>floor</t></ex></def-root>

FE.name: Creator
FE.definition:
<def-root>The Individual who creates the <fen>Part</fen>.
<ex>If <fex name="Creator">a mason's</fex> <t>wall</t> collapses, is it always his fault?</ex> </def-root>

lexUnit.name: fireplace.n
lexUnit.definition: COD: a partially enclosed space at the base of a chimney for a domestic fire

lexUnit.name: floor.n
lexUnit.definition: COD: the lower surface of a room, on which one may walk

lexUnit.name: ceiling.n
lexUnit.definition: COD: the upper interior surface of a room

lexUnit.name: mantel.n
lexUnit.definition: FN: a structure of wood, marble, or stone around a fireplace

lexUnit.name: roof.n
lexUnit.definition: FN: the structure covering the top of a building or vehicle (as seen from outside)

lexUnit.name: rail.n
lexUnit.definition: COD: a bar or series of bars fixed on upright supports or attached to a wall or ceiling, serving as part of a fence or barrier or used to hang things on

lexUnit.name: wall.n
lexUnit.definition: COD: a side of a building or room

lexUnit.name: counter.n
lexUnit.definition: FN: a flat-topped, level surface usually in the kitchen

lexUnit.name: facade.n
lexUnit.definition: COD: the face of a building, especially its principal front.

lexUnit.name: foundation.n
lexUnit.definition: FN: the base upon which a building is built

lexUnit.name: flight.n
lexUnit.definition: FN: a stair between floors/landings usually forming part of a larger stair .

lexUnit.name: landing.n
lexUnit.definition: FN: a section of floor from which a stairway is accessible, especially such a piece of floor between flights of stairs.
